entry.title: Combined summary - [BUG]: Bitcoin blockspace price discrimination put simple transactions at disadvantage
entry.summary:
The current pricing model for blockspace allocation in the Bitcoin network reveals inefficiencies that result in a misalignment of incentives and potential vulnerabilities. Analysis shows that there is an imbalance in the cost per byte between simple and complex transactions. For example, simple transactions are being assigned a higher weight compared to complex ones, as evidenced by the weight-to-byte ratio differences observed in specific transaction examples. These discrepancies lead to the misallocation of block space, devaluation of its worth, and disincentivization of simpler transactions.
Moreover, witness data, which is non-essential for the transaction's validation process, is currently discounted when stored within a block. This creates an incentive to store more data in the witness part of a block as it can be housed on slower, less expensive storage mediums. Conversely, data critical for validating new transactions resides in the chainstate directory, which requires fast storage for efficiency and to avoid excessive delays during the initial block download phase.
To address these issues, it has been suggested that the pricing should be uniform across all bytes, whether they are inside or outside of the witness data. This change would ensure a fair and efficient utilization of blockspace, equalizing the costs for sending coins to different types of addresses and making the spending of those coins more economical under certain conditions. The implementation of such a pricing correction could be incorporated into an update of Segwit transactions, promoting fairness and resolving the current system's shortcomings.
The community's response to this proposal will be crucial in determining its adoption. By bringing this adjustment to light, discussions can be initiated within the community to evaluate the merits and timing of integrating these changes into the network, ultimately contributing to the evolution of blockchain technology.
